Description: Crescentic arsenical copper blade of a battle-axe: with three rear projections or tangs forming two open scallops in the blade. Flanges are present around both scallops on the blade's inner edge. The central tang has a single binding-hole, the lateral tangs two each. Unusually, the lateral tangs expand towards the rear. The cutting end, now damaged by corrosion, was once worked to a keen edge. One face is pitted at the centre. All corrosion product has been cleaned off.
Bibliographic references: Davies 1987 / Catalogue of Egyptian Antiquities in the British Museum (79)
Acquisition name: Purchased from: R J Moss & Co
